</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Benefit Plan </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Full and
part-time U.S. based employees who are at least 18 years of age are eligible after six months of employment to participate in the Urban Outfitters 401(k) Savings Plan (the &#147;Plan&#148;). Under the Plan, employees can defer 1% to 25% of
compensation as defined. The Company makes matching contributions in cash of $0.25 per employee contribution dollar on the first 6% of the employee contribution. The employees&#146; contribution is 100% vested while the Company&#146;s matching
contribution vests at 20%&nbsp;per year of employee service. The Company&#146;s contributions were $969, $812 and $691 for fiscal years 2008, 2007 and 2006, respectively. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;
</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">F-24 </FONT></P>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>URBAN OUTFITTERS, INC. </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"
ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#151;(Continued) </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Contingencies </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Company is party to various legal proceedings arising from normal business activities. Management believes that the ultimate resolution of these matters will not have a material adverse effect on the
Company&#146;s financial position, results of operations or cash flows. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>11. Related Party Transactions </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Harry S. Cherken, Jr., a director of the Company, is a partner in the law firm of Drinker Biddle&nbsp;&amp; Reath LLP (&#147;DBR&#148;), which provides
general legal services to the Company. Fees paid to DBR during fiscal years 2008, 2007 and 2006 were $3,662, $1,493 and $1,458, respectively. Fees due to DBR for services rendered were $556 and $572 as of January 31, 2008 and 2007 respectively.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The McDevitt Company, a real estate company, acted as a broker in substantially all of the Company&#146;s new real estate transactions
during fiscal years 2008, 2007 and 2006. The Company has not paid any compensation to The McDevitt Company, but the Company has been advised that The McDevitt Company has received commissions from other parties to such transactions. Wade L. McDevitt
is the brother-in-law of Scott Belair, one of the Company&#146;s directors and is president and the sole shareholder of The McDevitt Company. There were no amounts due to The McDevitt Company as of January&nbsp;31, 2008. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Addis Group (&#147;Addis&#148;), an insurance brokerage company, acted as the Company&#146;s commercial insurance broker for the fiscal years ended
January&nbsp;31, 2008, 2007 and 2006. The Company has not paid any compensation to Addis for such services, but has been advised that Addis has received commissions from other parties to such transactions, to serve as risk manager under one line of
coverage. Scott Addis, the brother-in-law of Richard A. Hayne, Chairman of the Board of the Company, is President of the Addis Group. There were no amounts due to or from Addis as of January&nbsp;31, 2008. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>12. Segment Reporting </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Company is a national
retailer of lifestyle-oriented general merchandise with two reporting segments&#151;&#147;Retail&#148; and &#147;Wholesale&#148;. The Company&#146;s Retail segment consists of the aggregation of its three brands operating through 245 stores under
the retail names &#147;Urban Outfitters,&#148; &#147;Anthropologie,&#148; &#147;Free People&#148; and &#147;Terrain&#148; and includes their direct marketing campaigns which consist of three catalogs and four web sites as of January&nbsp;31, 2008.
Our retail stores and their direct marketing campaigns are considered operating segments. Net sales from the retail segment accounted for more than 93% of total consolidated net sales for the fiscal years ended January&nbsp;31, 2008, 2007 and 2006.
The remainder is derived from the Company&#146;s Wholesale segment that manufactures and distributes apparel to the retail segment and to approximately 1,700 better specialty retailers worldwide. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Company has aggregated its retail stores and associated direct marketing campaigns into a Retail segment based upon their unique management, customer
base and economic characteristics. Reporting in this format provides management with the financial information necessary to evaluate the </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">F-25 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>URBAN OUTFITTERS, INC. </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"
ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#151;(Continued) </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">success of the segments and the overall business. The Company evaluates the performance of the segments based on the net sales and pre-tax income from
operations (excluding inter-company charges) of the segment. Corporate expenses include expenses incurred and directed by the corporate office that are not allocated to segments. The principal identifiable assets for each operating segment are
inventories and property and equipment. Other assets are comprised primarily of general corporate assets, which principally consist of cash and cash equivalents, marketable securities, and other assets, and which are typically not allocated to the
Company&#146;s segments. The Company accounts for inter-segment sales and transfers as if the sales and transfers were made to third parties making similar volume purchases. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">F-26 </FONT></P>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The accounting policies of the operating segments are the same as the policies described in
Note&nbsp;2, &#147;Summary of Significant Accounting Policies.&#148; Both the retail and wholesale segments are highly diversified. No customer comprises more than 10% of sales. A summary of the information about the Company&#146;s operations by
segment is as follows: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.3
<SEQUENCE>2
<FILENAME>dex103.htm
<DESCRIPTION>CREDIT AGREEMENT - URBAN OUTFITTERS, INC. AND WACHOVIA BANK, NA
<TEXT>
<HTML><HEAD>
<TITLE>Credit Agreement - Urban Outfitters, Inc. and Wachovia Bank, NA</TITLE>
</HEAD>
 <BODY BGCOLOR="WHITE">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Exhibit 10.3 </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Execution Version </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>AMENDMENT NO.&nbsp;2 </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"
ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>TO </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>AMENDED AND RESTATED CREDIT AGREEMENT </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">THIS AMENDMENT No.&nbsp;2 TO AMENDED AND RESTATED CREDIT AGREEMENT (this &#147;<U>Second Amendment</U>&#148;), dated as of December&nbsp;10, 2007, is by
and among URBAN OUTFITTERS, INC., a Pennsylvania corporation (&#147;<U>Urban</U>&#148;), and certain of its subsidiaries listed on <U>Schedule 1</U> attached hereto (together with Urban, individually and collectively, the
&#147;<U>Borrowers</U>&#148;); the Lenders party to the Credit Agreement defined below, and WACHOVIA BANK, NATIONAL ASSOCIATION, as administrative agent for the Lenders (in such capacity, the &#147;<U>Administrative Agent</U>&#148;). </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">BACKGROUND </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">A. Pursuant to that certain
Amended and Restated Credit Agreement, dated as of September&nbsp;23, 2004, by and among the Borrowers, the Lenders referred to therein, and the Administrative Agent, as amended by (i)&nbsp;that certain Letter Agreement Concerning Amended and
Restated Note, dated May&nbsp;16, 2005, (ii)&nbsp;that certain First Amendment to Amended and Restated Credit Agreement, dated November&nbsp;30, 2006, (iii)&nbsp;that certain Letter Agreement Concerning Amended and Restated Note, dated May&nbsp;31,
2007, and (iv)&nbsp;that certain Extension of Amended and Restated Credit Agreement, dated as of November&nbsp;27, 2007 (as so amended, the &#147;<U>Existing Credit Agreement</U>&#148;) the Lenders agreed, <I>inter alia</I>, to provide for a
revolving line of credit in the maximum principal amount of Fifty Million Dollars ($50,000,000) to fund working capital (including capital expenditures), to support the issuance of documentary and standby Letters of Credit, and to finance the
general corporate purposes of the Borrowers. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">B. Borrowers have requested to amend the Existing Credit Agreement, to, <I>inter alia</I>:
(i)&nbsp;increase the maximum principal amount available pursuant to the Credit Agreement (as defined below) to Sixty Million Dollars ($60,000,000), (ii)&nbsp;provide for the ability to increase the Commitment Amount up to the maximum principal
amount of One Hundred Million Dollars ($100,000,000), (iii)&nbsp;increase the sublimits for the issuance of documentary and standby Letters of Credit, (iv)&nbsp;to extend the Termination Date to December&nbsp;10, 2010, and (v)&nbsp;add certain
additional Guarantors (the Existing Credit Agreement, as amended by the Second Amendment, and as may be further amended from time to time, the &#147;<U>Credit Agreement</U>&#148;). </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">C. The Lenders and the Administrative Agent have agreed to the foregoing modifications, as more particularly described herein and subject to the terms
and conditions hereof. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the foregoing premises and for other good and valuable consideration, the
receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, and intending to be legally bound hereby, the parties agree as follows: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">1. <U>Definitions</U>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a) <U>General Rule</U>. Except as expressly set forth herein, all capitalized terms used
and defined herein have the respective meanings ascribed thereto in the Credit Agreement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b) <U>Additional
Definitions</U>. The following additional definitions are added to Section&nbsp;1.1 of the Credit Agreement to read in their entireties as follows: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">&#147;<U>CyberImport International Operations Agreement</U>&#148; means that certain CyberImport International Operations Agreement, dated as of January&nbsp;8, 2004, by and between Urban and Wachovia. </FONT></P>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<U>euro</U>&#148; means the lawful currency of the European Union. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<U>Hong Kong Dollars</U>&#148; means the lawful currency of Hong Kong. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<U>Joinder to Guaranty</U>&#148; means a Joinder to Guaranty made by a Subsidiary of any of the Borrowers, substantially in the form of Exhibit II to the Second Amendment, pursuant to which such Subsidiary
becomes a Guarantor. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<U>Material Acquisition</U>&#148; means any acquisition of assets comprising all or substantially all of an
operating unit of a business or substantially all of the equity interests of a Person that involves payment of aggregate consideration (including, without limitation, earn outs, bonuses, non-compete and similar payments, and transition and
consulting arrangements) in excess of Twenty Million Dollars ($20,000,000) (whether paid or payable in cash or other property (including equity interests)). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<U>Material Disposition</U>&#148; means any disposition of assets comprising all or substantially all of the equity interests of a Person that involves payment of aggregate consideration (including, without
limitation, earn outs, bonuses, non-compete and similar payments, and transition and consulting arrangements) in excess of Twenty Million Dollars ($20,000,000) (whether paid or payable in cash or other property (including equity interests)).
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<U>Non-U.S. Subsidiary</U>&#148; means a Subsidiary formed in a jurisdiction located outside of the United States. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<U>Restricted Subsidiary</U>&#148; means, collectively, O.U Real Estate Holding I LLC, O.U. Real Estate Holding II LLC and Urban Merchandise, Inc.,
and such other Subsidiaries as Urban and the Administrative Agent may from time to time agree. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<U>Second Amendment</U>&#148; means
that certain Amendment No.&nbsp;2 to Amended and Restated Credit Agreement, by and among Borrowers, Lenders, and Administrative Agent, dated as of December&nbsp;10, 2007. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<U>Second Amendment Documents</U>&#148; means, collectively, the Second Amendment, the Joinder to Guaranty, the Third Amended and Restated Note, the Continuing Letter of Credit Agreement, and each other
document, instrument, certificate and agreement executed and delivered by any Borrower, any Subsidiary, or any Guarantor in connection with the Second Amendment or otherwise referred to therein or contemplated thereby all as they may be amended,
restated or otherwise modified. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<U>Second Amendment Effective Date</U>&#148; means the date on which the conditions set forth in
<U>Section&nbsp;12</U> of the Second Amendment have been satisfied. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<U>Swedish Krona (SEK)</U>&#148; means the lawful currency of
Sweden. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-2- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<U>Third Amended and Restated Notes</U>&#148; means, collectively, those certain Third Amended and
Restated Promissory Notes, each dated as of December&nbsp;10, 2007, by the Borrowers in favor of each Lender, substantially in the form of Exhibit III to the Second Amendment.&#148; </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(c) <U>Amended Definitions</U>. The following definitions are amended and restated to read in their entireties as follows: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<U>Aggregate Commitment</U>&#148; means the aggregate amount of the Lenders&#146; Commitments hereunder, as such amount may be reduced, increased,
or otherwise modified at any time and from time to time pursuant to the terms hereof. On the Second Amendment Effective Date, the Aggregate Commitment shall be Sixty Million Dollars ($60,000,000), as such amount may be increased in accordance with
<U>Section&nbsp;2.5(b)</U> hereof. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<U>Alternate Currency</U>&#148; means as of the date hereof Pounds Sterling, Hong Kong Dollars,
Swedish Krona (SEK), and the euro and hereafter means such currencies or such other lawful currency other than Dollars that is freely transferable and convertible into Dollars as each Lender and Administrative Agent may mutually agree and from time
to time designate as an Alternate Currency, each such Alternate Currency specified herein or hereafter designated to remain in effect as such until notice is given by any Lender or Administrative Agent that such currency is no longer available as an
Alternate Currency. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<U>Alternate Currency Sublimit</U>&#148; means the Dollar Equivalent of the portion of the Aggregate Commitment
up to which Lenders have agreed to make Alternate Currency Loans and/or issue Alternate Currency Letters of Credit (subject to the L/C Commitment), being Four Million Dollars ($4,000,000). </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<U>Base Rate</U>&#148; means Wachovia&#146;s Prime Rate. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<U>Continuing Letter of Credit Agreement</U>&#148; means the Continuing Letter of Credit Agreement in the form of <U>Exhibit I</U> to the Second Amendment to be entered into by the Borrowers, Guarantors and
Issuing Lender, which replaces each of (a)&nbsp;that certain Continuing Letter of Credit Agreement dated as of October&nbsp;12, 2001, by and between certain of the Borrowers, certain of the Guarantors, and First Union National Bank (predecessor in
interest to Wachovia), and (b)&nbsp;the CyberImport International Operations Agreement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<U>Guarantors</U>&#148; means collectively
those direct and indirect Subsidiaries of the Borrowers set forth on <U>Schedule 3</U> to the Second Amendment, and &#147;<U>Guarantor</U>&#148; means any of such Guarantors and each additional entity whether now owned or hereafter acquired that
becomes a Guarantor pursuant to Section&nbsp;8.12 hereof. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<U>L/C Commitment</U>&#148; means: (a)&nbsp;in the case of documentary
Letters of Credit, the Aggregate Commitment, and (b)&nbsp;in the case of standby Letters of Credit, the lesser of (i)&nbsp;the Aggregate Commitment and (ii)&nbsp;Four Million Dollars ($4,000,000). </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-3- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<U>Loan Documents</U>&#148; means, collectively, this Agreement, the Note, the Guaranty Agreement,
Joinders to Guaranty, the Applications, the Letters of Credit and each other document, instrument, certificate and agreement executed and delivered by any Borrower, any Subsidiary, any Guarantor or their counsel in connection with this Agreement or
otherwise referred to herein or contemplated hereby, all as may be amended, restated or otherwise modified, including, without limitation, the First Amendment Documents and the Second Amendment Documents. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<U>Non-U.S. Sublimit</U>&#148; means, without duplication, the maximum aggregate amount which may be outstanding at any time for: (i)&nbsp;Loans
borrowed by or on behalf of any Non-U.S. Borrower or Subsidiary thereof, (ii)&nbsp;intercompany loans to any Non-U.S. Borrower or Subsidiary (other than the Restricted Subsidiaries) thereof permitted under <U>Section&nbsp;10.4(d)</U> hereof; and
(iii)&nbsp;L/C Obligations for Letters of Credit issued for the account of any Non-U.S. Borrower or Subsidiary thereof, being Four Million Dollars ($4,000,000) on the date hereof. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<U>Rents</U>&#148; means all cash payments made to a landlord in connection with a lease of real property, including without limitation payments for
rent, utilities and taxes, property insurance, and common area maintenance charges.&#148; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(d) <U>Other Definitions and
Provisions</U>. The following additional provision is hereby added to Section&nbsp;1.3 of the Credit Agreement, to read in its entirety as follows: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(e) <U>Calculation of EBIT and EBITDAR</U>. For the purpose of calculating EBIT and EBITDAR, for any period of determination, (i)&nbsp;if at any time during such period a Material Acquisition is made, EBIT and EBITDAR
shall be calculated after giving the pro forma effect to such Material Acquisition (if positive) as if it had occurred on the first day of such period, and (ii)&nbsp;if at any time during such period a Material Disposition is made, EBIT and EBITDAR
shall be reduced by an amount equal to EBIT and EBITDAR (if positive) attributed to the property that is subject to such Material Disposition or increased by an amount equal to EBIT or EBITDAR (if negative) attributed to the property that is subject
to such Material Disposition. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2. <U>Replacement of Schedules 2 (Lenders and Commitments) and 3 (Guarantors)</U>. Schedules
2 and 3 to the Credit Agreement are hereby amended and restated in their entireties as set forth on <U>Schedule 2</U> and <U>Schedule 3</U>, respectively, to this Second Amendment. All references in the Loan Agreement to <U>Schedule 2</U> and
<U>Schedule 3</U>, respectively, shall be deemed to be references to the <U>Schedule 2</U> and <U>Schedule 3</U>, respectively, attached to this Second Amendment. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3. <U>Modification of Section&nbsp;2.1 of the Credit Agreement</U>. Section&nbsp;2.1 of the Credit Agreement is hereby amended and
restated to read in its entirety as follows: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;2.1 <U>Loans</U>. Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, each Lender
severally agrees to make Loans to the Borrowers from time to time from the Closing Date through the Termination Date as requested by the Borrowers in accordance with the terms of hereof; <U>provided</U>, that </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a) the aggregate principal amount of all outstanding Loans (after giving effect to any amount requested) shall not exceed the Aggregate Commitment
<U>less</U> the sum of all L/C Obligations, </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-4- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b) the principal amount of outstanding Loans from any Lender to the Borrowers shall not at any time
exceed such Lender&#146;s Commitment as set forth on <U>Schedule 2</U> hereto <U>less</U> such Lender&#146;s Commitment Percentage of outstanding L/C Obligations, </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(c) the aggregate principal amount of all outstanding Loans to Non-U.S. Borrowers (after giving effect to any amount requested) shall not at any time exceed the Non-U.S. Sublimit <U>less</U> the sum of: (i)&nbsp;the
aggregate principal amount of all outstanding intercompany loans (without duplication) to (x)&nbsp;any Non-U.S. Borrower or (y)&nbsp;any Non-U.S. Subsidiary permitted under <U>Section&nbsp;10.4(d)</U> hereof and (ii)&nbsp;all L/C Obligations for
Letters of Credit issued for the account of any Non-U.S. Borrower, </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(d) Lenders may make Alternate Currency Loans only to Non-U.S.
Borrowers; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(e) the Dollar Equivalent of the Alternate Currency Exposure shall not at any time exceed the Alternate Currency Sublimit;
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(f) Non-U.S. Borrowers may borrow only Alternate Currency Loans; </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(g) Restricted Subsidiaries shall not receive, in whole or in part, directly or indirectly (including, without limitation, through intercompany loans), in
any form (whether currency, property, credits, or otherwise), the proceeds of any Loans. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Each Loan by a Lender shall be in a principal
amount equal to such Lender&#146;s Commitment Percentage of the aggregate principal amount of Loans requested on such occasion. Subject to the terms and conditions hereof, the Borrowers may borrow, repay and reborrow Loans hereunder until the
Termination Date.&#148; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4. <U>Modification of Section&nbsp;2.5(b) of the Credit Agreement</U>. Section&nbsp;2.5(b) of the
Credit Agreement is hereby amended and restated to read in its entirety as follows: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;(b) <U>Increases</U>. So long as no Default or
Event of Default has occurred and is continuing hereunder, the Borrowers shall have the right at any time and from time to time, upon at least seven (7)&nbsp;Business Days prior written notice to the Administrative Agent, to increase the Aggregate
Commitment, in one or more tranches, by an aggregate principal amount not to exceed Forty Million Dollars ($40,000,000).<B><I> </I></B>Each such increase permitted pursuant to this <U>Section&nbsp;2.5(b) </U>shall be conditioned upon Borrowers&#146;
compliance, as of the effective date of any such increase, with the requirements of <U>Section&nbsp;5.2(b)</U> hereto, as required by the Administrative Agent, which requirements may include without limitation, the execution and delivery of an
amendment agreement in form and substance satisfactory to the Required Lenders, the delivery of replacement or additional promissory notes, and confirmations of Guaranty Agreements.&#148; </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">5. <U>Modification of Section&nbsp;2.6 of the Credit Agreement</U>. Section&nbsp;2.6 of the Credit Agreement is hereby amended and
restated to read in its entirety as follows: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<U>Termination of the Aggregate Commitment</U>. The Aggregate Commitment shall terminate
on the earliest of: (a)&nbsp;December&nbsp;10, 2010; (b)&nbsp;the date of termination by the Borrowers pursuant to <U>Section&nbsp;2.5(a)</U> hereof; and (c)&nbsp;the date of termination by the Administrative Agent on behalf of the Lenders pursuant
to <U>Section&nbsp;11.2(a)</U> hereof; <U>provided</U>, <U>however</U>, that Urban may submit to the Administrative Agent a Termination Date Extension Request (which shall be submitted without limitation with the annual </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-5- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">business plan and financial projections required to be delivered under <U>Section&nbsp;7.1(d)</U> hereof), pursuant to which each Lender, at its sole
discretion, may agree to extend the Termination Date of its respective Commitment set forth in subsection (a)&nbsp;of this <U>Section&nbsp;2.6</U> by an additional three hundred sixty-four (364)&nbsp;day term. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6. <U>Modification of Section&nbsp;3.6(a) of the Credit Agreement</U>. Section&nbsp;3.6(a) of the Credit Agreement is hereby amended and
restated to read in its entirety as follows: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;(a) The Borrowers shall pay to the Administrative Agent for the account of the Issuing
Lender and the L/C Participants on a pro rata basis (i)&nbsp;fees with respect to documentary Letters of Credit as set forth on <U>Schedule 5</U> attached to the Second Amendment, as such schedule may change from time to time in accordance with the
Issuing Lender&#146;s general practices, and (ii)&nbsp;a letter of credit fee with respect to each standby Letter of Credit in an amount equal to the Applicable Margin for a LIBOR Rate Loan or Eurocurrency Loan, as the case may be, as of the date of
the calculation of the fee on a per annum basis multiplied by the face amount of each standby Letter of Credit as then in effect. Each such commission shall be payable quarterly in arrears on the last Business Day of each calendar quarter and on the
Termination Date.&#148; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">7. <U>Modification of Section&nbsp;3.12 of the Credit Agreement</U>. Section&nbsp;3.12 of the
Credit Agreement is hereby amended and restated to read in its entirety as follows: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<U>Letter of Credit Documents</U>. Subject to
Section&nbsp;3.11 hereof, Letters of Credit and amendments thereto issued by Wachovia, as Issuing Lender, shall be requested, processed and issued, and draws thereon shall be negotiated, processed and paid, in accordance with and subject to the
terms and procedures of the Continuing Letter of Credit Agreement.&#148; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">8. <U>Modification of Section&nbsp;8.12 of the
Credit Agreement</U>. Section&nbsp;8.12 of the Credit Agreement is hereby amended and restated to read in its entirety as follows: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">&#147;<U>Additional Guarantors</U>. Within ten (10)&nbsp;days after any Subsidiary of any Borrower with at least $20,000,000 of equity is created or acquired after the Closing Date, give notice thereof to the Administrative Agent of such
creation or acquisition and whether such Subsidiary shall be formed under a jurisdiction outside of the United States, and cause to be executed and delivered to the Administrative Agent: (a)&nbsp;a duly executed Guaranty Agreement or Joinder to
Guaranty or other supplement thereto, with such changes as the Administrative Agent may reasonably request, it being acknowledged and agreed that, with respect to guaranties by Non-U.S. Subsidiaries, such guaranties will contain provisions limiting
recourse thereunder to the extent (i)&nbsp;required to render them enforceable under applicable law and (ii)&nbsp;necessary to avoid any deemed distribution or similar issue, and (b)&nbsp;favorable legal opinions addressed to the Administrative
Agent and the Lenders in form and substance satisfactory thereto with respect to the enforceability of such Guaranty Agreement and such other documents and closing certificates as may be requested by the Administrative Agent.&#148; </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">9. <U>Modification of Section&nbsp;10.2(b) of the Credit Agreement</U>. Section&nbsp;10.2(b) of the Credit Agreement is hereby amended
and restated to read in its entirety as follows: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;(b) Guaranty Obligations of Urban for the benefit of any Subsidiary (other than a
Restricted Subsidiary) of Debt permitted by Section&nbsp;10.1(a), Section&nbsp;10.1(b), Section 10.1(c), Section&nbsp;10.1(d), Section&nbsp;10.1(e), Section&nbsp;10.1(f), Section&nbsp;10.1(g), and Section&nbsp;10.1(h) hereof.&#148; </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-6- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">10. <U>Modification of Section&nbsp;10.4(c) of the Credit Agreement</U>.
Section&nbsp;10.4(c) of the Credit Agreement is hereby amended and restated to read in its entirety as follows: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;(c) investments by
any Borrower or any Subsidiary (other than a Restricted Subsidiary) in the form of acquisitions of all or substantially all of the business or a line of business (whether by merger (so long as a Borrower and Subsidiary is the surviving entity), the
acquisition of capital stock, assets or any combination thereof) of any other Person; provided that the aggregate purchase price paid or payable in connection with all such acquisitions made on or after the date of the Second Amendment does not
exceed $150,000,000; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">11. <U>Modification of Section&nbsp;10.5 of the Credit Agreement</U>. Section&nbsp;10.5 of the Credit
Agreement is hereby amended and restated in its entirety to read as follows: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;Section 10.5 <U>Limitation on Mergers and
Liquidation</U>. Merge, consolidate or enter into any similar combination with any other Person or liquidate, wind-up or dissolve itself (or suffer any liquidation or dissolution) except: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a) any Wholly Owned Subsidiary of any Borrower may merge with any other Wholly-Owned Subsidiary of any Borrower, except where the survivor of such merger
is a Restricted Subsidiary; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b) any Wholly-Owned Subsidiary may merge with or into any Person acquired in accordance with
Section&nbsp;10.4(c) hereof; and </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(c) any Wholly-Owned Subsidiary of any Borrower may wind-up into any Borrower or any other Wholly-Owned
Subsidiary (other than a Restricted Subsidiary) of any Borrower.&#148; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">12. <U>Modification of Section&nbsp;10.6 of the
Credit Agreement</U>. Section&nbsp;10.6 of the Credit Agreement is hereby amended and restated to read in its entirety as follows: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">&#147;10.6 <U>Limitations on Sale of Assets</U>. Convey, sell, lease, assign, transfer or otherwise dispose of any of its property, business or assets (including without limitation the sale of any receivables and leasehold interests and any
sale-leaseback or similar transaction), whether now owned or hereafter acquired except: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a) the sale of inventory in the
ordinary course of business; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b) the sale of obsolete assets no longer used or usable in the business of any Borrower or
any Subsidiary; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(c) the transfer of assets to any Borrower or any Wholly-Owned Subsidiary (other than a Restricted
Subsidiary) of any Borrower pursuant to <U>Section&nbsp;10.5(c)</U> hereof; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-7- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(d) the transfer of assets to any Guarantor pursuant to <U>Section&nbsp;10.4(d)</U>
hereof; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(e) dispositions by any Borrower or any Subsidiary of property pursuant to sale-leaseback transactions, provided
that the book value of all property so disposed of shall not exceed $10,000,000 from and after the date of the Second Amendment; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">(f) the sale or discount without recourse of accounts receivable arising in the ordinary course of business in connection with the compromise or collection thereof; and </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(g) the sale, transfer or other disposition of any other assets not to exceed $25,000,000 in the aggregate, valued at the higher of book
value or sales price, in any twelve month period.&#148; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">13. <U>Modification of Section&nbsp;10.7(c) of the Credit
Agreement</U>. 10.7(c) of the Credit Agreement is hereby amended and restated to read in its entirety as follows: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;(c) with the
approval of the board of directors of Urban, Urban may: (i)&nbsp;repurchase shares of its capital stock, <U>provided</U> that the Fixed Charge Coverage Ratio of Urban and its Consolidated Subsidiaries as of the most recently ended fiscal quarter is
not less than the ratio required pursuant to Section&nbsp;9.1 of the Credit Agreement (the &#147;<U>Required Ratio</U>&#148;), and that each such repurchase of shares of capital stock would not cause the Fixed Charge Coverage Ratio to be less than
the Required Ratio; (ii)&nbsp;repurchase fractional shares of its capital stock in connection with any stock split or reverse stock split of Urban&#146;s capital stock, the purchase price (based on fair market value) of which does not exceed
$5,000,000 in the aggregate; and (iii)&nbsp;pay dividends with respect to any of its capital stock, <U>provided</U> that the Fixed Charge Coverage Ratio of Urban and its Consolidated Subsidiaries as of the most recently ended fiscal quarter is not
less than the Required Ratio, and that such payment of dividends would not cause the Fixed Charge Coverage Ratio to be less than the Required Ratio for the next succeeding fiscal quarter.&#148; </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">14. <U>Modification of Section&nbsp;10.13 of the Credit Agreement</U>. Section&nbsp;10.13 of the Credit Agreement is hereby amended and
restated to read in its entirety as follows: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<U>Capital Expenditures</U>. Make Capital Expenditure Payments, for the Borrowers and
all Subsidiaries, collectively, exceeding: (a)&nbsp;$145,000,000 in the aggregate Fiscal Year ending January&nbsp;31, 2008, (b)&nbsp;$185,000,000 in the aggregate in the Fiscal Year ending January&nbsp;31, 2009, (c)&nbsp;$225,000,000 in the
aggregate in the Fiscal Year ending January&nbsp;31, 2010, and (d)&nbsp;$280,000,000 in the aggregate in the Fiscal Year ending January&nbsp;31, 2011; provided that no such Capital Expenditure Payment shall be made by, on behalf of, or for the
benefit of, any Restricted Subsidiary.&#148; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">15. <U>Modification of Section&nbsp;13.1(b) of the Credit Agreement</U>.

</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">16. <U>Representations and Warranties</U>. Borrowers hereby represent and warrant
to Lenders, as to themselves and their Subsidiaries, as follows: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a) <U>Representations</U>. As of the Second Amendment
Effective Date and after giving effect thereto, the Borrowers represent and warrant as follows: (i)&nbsp;the representations and warranties set forth in Article VI of the Credit Agreement are true and correct in all material respects, except for any
representation or warranty made as of an earlier date, which representation and warranty shall remain true and correct as of such earlier date; and (ii)&nbsp;no Event of Default or Default under the Credit Agreement, as amended hereby, has occurred
and is continuing. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b) <U>Power and Authority</U>. Each Borrower has the power and authority under the laws of its
jurisdiction of formation and under its respective formation documents to enter into and perform this Second Amendment and the other Second Amendment Documents to which Borrower is a party; all necessary actions (corporate or otherwise) for the
execution and performance by each Borrower of the Amendment Documents have been taken; and each of the Second Amendment Documents and the Credit Agreement, as amended, constitute the valid and binding obligations of Borrowers, enforceable in
accordance with its respective terms. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-9- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(c) <U>No Violations of Law or Agreements</U>. The execution and performance of the
Second Amendment Documents by Borrowers and Guarantors will not: (i)&nbsp;violate any provisions of any law or regulation, federal, state, local, or foreign, or any formation document of any Borrower; or (ii)&nbsp;result in any breach or violation
of, or constitute a default or require the obtaining of any consent under, any material agreement or instrument by which any Borrower or its property may be bound. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">17. <U>Conditions to Effectiveness of Amendment</U>. This Second Amendment shall be effective upon the date of Administrative Agent&#146;s
receipt of the following documents, each in form and substance reasonably satisfactory to Administrative Agent: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a)
<U>Second Amendment</U>. This Second Amendment duly executed and delivered by each of Borrowers, the Lenders, and the Administrative Agent. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b) <U>Amended Disclosure Schedules to Credit Agreement</U>. The amended disclosure schedules to Credit Agreement, attached hereto as <U>Schedule 1</U>, <U>Schedule 2</U>, <U>Schedule 3</U>, <U>Schedule 4</U>,
<U>Schedule 5</U>, <U>Schedule 6.1(a)</U>, <U>Schedule 6.1(b)</U>, <U>Schedule 6.1(i)</U>, <U>Schedule 6.1(l)</U>, <U>Schedule 6.1(m)</U>, <U>Schedule 6.1(t)</U>, <U>Schedule 6.1(u)</U>, <U>Schedule 10.3</U>, <U>Schedule 10.4(a)</U>, <U>and Schedule
10.4(b)</U>, respectively. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(c) <U>Third Amended and Restated Notes</U>. The Third Amended and Restated Notes, each dated of
even date herewith, by the Borrowers in favor of each Lender, in the aggregate maximum principal amount of Sixty Million Dollars ($60,000,000), in the form, attached hereto as <U>Exhibit III</U>. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(d) <U>Joinder to Guaranty</U>. The Joinder to Guaranty, duly executed and delivered by U. O. Real Estate LLC, guarantying the
Borrowers&#146; obligations under the Credit Agreement, in the form attached hereto as <U>Exhibit II</U>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(e) <U>Continuing
Letter of Credit Agreement</U>, in the form attached hereto as <U>Exhibit I</U>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(f) <U>Financial Condition Certificate of
the Borrowers</U>, in the form attached hereto as <U>Exhibit IV</U>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(g) <U>Secretary&#146;s Certificate for each of the
Borrowers</U>. Secretary&#146;s Certificate for each of the Borrowers, including and/or attaching, as the case may be: a (i)&nbsp;certification of the incumbency for such Borrower, (ii)&nbsp;certification of no changes to the formation documents of
such Borrower (including, without limitation, articles of incorporation, by-laws, operating agreement, and other similar organizational documents, as the case may be) since the last delivery to the Administrative Agent of such formation documents by
such Borrower, or copies of amended formation documents, (iii)&nbsp;resolutions of the Board of Directors (or equivalent governing body) of each of the Borrowers, approving the Second Amendment and the transactions contemplated thereby, and
(iv)&nbsp;certificates of good standing or subsistence, as the case may be, issued by the Secretary of State of each Borrower&#146;s jurisdiction of incorporation or organization, as the case may be. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(h) <U>Secretary&#146;s Certificate for each of the Guarantors</U>. Secretary&#146;s Certificate for each of the Guarantors, including
and/or attaching, as the case may be: a (i)&nbsp;certification of the incumbency for such Guarantor, (ii)&nbsp;(A)&nbsp;U. O. Real Estate LLC, delivery of the formation documents of such Guarantor (including, without limitation, articles of
incorporation, by-laws, operating agreement, and other similar organizational documents, as the case may be), or (B)&nbsp;for each other Guarantor, certification of no changes to the formation documents of such Guarantor (including, without
limitation, articles of incorporation, by-laws, operating agreement, and other similar organizational documents, as the case may be) since the last delivery to the Administrative Agent of such formation documents by such </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-10- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Borrower, or copies of amended formation documents, (iii)&nbsp;resolutions of the Board of Directors (or equivalent governing body) of each of the
Guarantors, approving the Second Amendment and the transactions contemplated thereby, and (iv)&nbsp;certificates of good standing or subsistence, as the case may be, issued by the Secretary of State of each Guarantor&#146;s jurisdiction of
incorporation or organization, as the case may be. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(i) <U>Officer Compliance Certificate</U>. Officer Compliance
Certificate executed and delivered by an authorized officer of Urban, in substantially the form attached hereto as <U>Exhibit V</U>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">(j) <U>U.S. Legal Opinion</U>. Legal Opinion of Drinker, Biddle&nbsp;&amp; Reath LLP, U.S. counsel to the Borrowers and Guarantors, in form and substantially satisfactory to the Administrative Agent. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(k) <U>U.K. Legal Certificate</U>. Certification by Stephenson Harwood, U.K. counsel to the Borrowers, in form and substance satisfactory
to the Administrative Agent, that there has been no change in the underlying laws upon which the Legal Opinion of Stephenson Harwood, delivered to the Administrative Agent in connection with the execution of the Credit Agreement, was based that
would render such opinion no longer valid in all respects. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(l) <U>Ireland Legal Certification</U>. Certification by Mason
Hayes&nbsp;&amp; Curran, Ireland counsel to the Borrowers, in form and substance satisfactory to the Administrative Agent, that there has been no change in the underlying laws upon which the Legal Opinion of Mason Hayes&nbsp;&amp; Curran, delivered
to the Administrative Agent in connection with the execution of the Credit Agreement, was based that would render such opinion no longer valid in all respects. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(m) <U>Other Documents</U>. Such additional documents and materials as Administrative Agent may reasonably request. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(n) <U>Payment of the Administrative Agent&#146;s Legal and Other Fees</U>. Payment to the Administrative Agent for (i)&nbsp;the
Administration Fee contemplated by Section&nbsp;4.3(a) of the Credit Agreement; and (ii)&nbsp;all reasonable fees and expenses (including without limitation reasonable fees and expenses of counsel) incurred by Administrative Agent in connection with
the preparation, execution and delivery of this Second Amendment. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(o) <U>Evidence of Hazard and Liability Insurance</U>.
Evidence that the Borrowers have in place Hazard and Liability Insurance as required pursuant to Section&nbsp;8.2 of the Credit Agreement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">18. <U>Affirmations</U>. Borrowers hereby: (i)&nbsp;affirm all the provisions of the Credit Agreement, as amended by this Second Amendment; and (ii)&nbsp;agree that the terms and conditions of the Credit Agreement
shall continue in full force and effect, as amended hereby. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">19. <U>Miscellaneous</U>. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a) Borrowers agree to pay Administrative Agent for all reasonable fees and expenses (including without limitation reasonable fees and
expenses of counsel) incurred by Administrative Agent and its counsel in connection with the due diligence review, the preparation, execution and delivery of this Second Amendment, and the future administration by the Administrative Agent of this
Second Amendment and the transactions contemplated hereby. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-11- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b) This Second Amendment shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws
of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, without regard to conflicts of law or choice of law principles. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(c) This Second
Amendment may be executed in any number of counterparts and by different parties hereto in separate counterparts, each of which when so executed shall be deemed to be an original and shall be binding upon all parties, their successors and assigns,
and all of which taken together shall constitute one and the same agreement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(d) <U>Entirety</U>. This Second Amendment,
together with the other Second Amendment Documents, the Credit Agreement, and the other Loan Documents, represents the entire agreement of the parties hereto and thereto, and supersedes all prior agreements and understandings, oral and written, if
any, including any commitment letters or correspondence relating to the Second Amendment Documents, the other Loan Documents or the transactions contemplated herein or therein, </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(e) <U>No Waiver</U>. Except as expressly set forth herein, the execution, delivery and performance of this Second Amendment shall not
operate as a waiver of any right, power or remedy of Administrative Agent, any Issuing Lender, or Lenders under the Credit Agreement and the agreements and documents executed in connection therewith or constitute a waiver of any provision thereof.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">[Signature Pages Follow] </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<DESCRIPTION>SECTION 302 CERTIFICATION OF PRINCIPAL EXECUTIVE OFFICER
<TEXT>
<HTML><HEAD>
<TITLE>Section 302 Certification of Principal Executive Officer</TITLE>
</HEAD>
 <BODY BGCOLOR="WHITE">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>EXHIBIT 31.1 </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>CERTIFICATION OF PRINCIPAL EXECUTIVE OFFICER </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>PURSUANT TO SECTION 302 OF THE SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF
2002 </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">I, Glen T. Senk, certify that: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">I have reviewed this annual report on Form 10-K of Urban Outfitters, Inc.; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the
circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of
operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this report; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The registrant&#146;s other certifying officer and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e)
and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the registrant and have: </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">a)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information
relating to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">b)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable
assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">c)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Evaluated the effectiveness of the registrant&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure
controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">d)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Disclosed in this report any change in the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the registrant&#146;s most recent fiscal quarter (the
registrant&#146;s fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting; and </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">5.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The registrant&#146;s other certifying officer and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant&#146;s
auditors and the audit committee of the registrant&#146;s board of directors: </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">a)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the
registrant&#146;s ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">b)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting.
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<DESCRIPTION>SECTION 302 CERTIFICATION OF PRINCIPAL FINANCIAL OFFICER
<TEXT>
<HTML><HEAD>
<TITLE>Section 302 Certification of Principal Financial Officer</TITLE>
</HEAD>
 <BODY BGCOLOR="WHITE">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>EXHIBIT 31.2 </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>CERTIFICATION OF PRINCIPAL EXECUTIVE OFFICER </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>PURSUANT TO SECTION 302 OF THE SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF
2002 </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">I, John E. Kyees, certify that: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">I have reviewed this annual report on Form 10-K of Urban Outfitters, Inc.; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the
circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of
operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this report; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The registrant&#146;s other certifying officer and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e)
and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the registrant and have: </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">a)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information
relating to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">b)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable
assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">c)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Evaluated the effectiveness of the registrant&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure
controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">d)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Disclosed in this report any change in the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the registrant&#146;s most recent fiscal quarter (the
registrant&#146;s fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting; and </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">5.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The registrant&#146;s other certifying officer and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant&#146;s
auditors and the audit committee of the registrant&#146;s board of directors: </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">a)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the
registrant&#146;s ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
